page.title: 14Guildford hospitals
page.content:
{St. Luke's Hospital}has ten wards, 15 doctors, 300 nurses, about 18000 resident patients and about 23000 out patients a year. There are pathology and radiography laboratories and a pharmacy.
{Mount Alvernia}is a private hospital which has room for 120 patients. There are 200 nurses including 28 nuns. The hospital has 4000 admissions a year 3500 of which are surgical cases. Doctors are not permanent staff at the hospital but come in if their patients are admitted.
{The Red Cross Society}was founded by Henri Dunant from Geneva in 1869. It trains people to help the injured. The society's symbol is the reverse of the Swiss flag and represents peace.
